locutie.beschrijving: The preacher recounts the narrative of Jesus walking on water, linking it to the chaos-imagery of Second Isaiah and the feeding of the five thousand. It focuses on the 'adverse wind' as a metaphor for contemporary anxiety.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong intertextual links between Markan 'I am' and Isaianic 'Ani Hu'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily 'talks about' the power of Jesus' utterance rather than directly uttering it to the congregation until the very end.
voorbeelden: I will line it out for you one more time.
The storm produces a more elemental, inchoate anxiety.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from anxiety (fear) to trust (faith) by realizing the authority of Jesus over chaos.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Minimal until the final Trinitarian formula.

voorbeelden: The Bible is much more preoccupied with the threat of chaos.
He changes nothing... until he speaks.
Quit watching the storm and listen!
I would have thought they would have welcomed him.
If you are like me, you need to hear it.
The good news that I announce to you...
Jesus and his 'do not fear' continue to be uttered and will finally utter us beyond our fear.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but delayed. The preacher waits until the final paragraph to move from description to promise.

voorbeelden: I announce to you in the name of...
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher assumes the role of a 'mandatary' only in the conclusion.

indicatoren: The entire drama... is present in this narrative.
I will line it out for you.
The good exegetes know what comes after...
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a biblical drama rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Immediate address of the promise to the 'you' earlier in the text
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement with the power of Jesus' word, but delayed existential impact.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The final toezegging is high quality but functions as a 'coda' rather than the engine of the sermon.
voorbeelden: The good news that I announce to you... is this: Jesus... will finally utter us beyond our fear.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to establish solidarity ('like me') and to frame the act of preaching ('I will line it out').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address is sparse until the end; often used to describe the 'you' of the disciples rather than the 'you' of the listener.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the final call to 'listen'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the analysis of the text, the storm, and the disciples.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere where the 'storm' is discussed as a concept.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Narrating the Markan and Isaianic history.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Describing the nature of chaos and the human condition.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the proclamation in the final paragraph.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids pure moralism (Directive without Indicative).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The storm/The text) -> Commissive (The announcement of good news) -> Directive (Quit watching and listen).
voorbeelden: The final paragraph follows this perfectly.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is correct but the 'Assertive' phase is disproportionately long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Jesus... will finally utter us beyond our fear. Quit watching the storm and listen!

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological lecture on the performative power of Jesus' word, but it delays its own performative action until the final seconds.

sterke_punten.effect: Provides a profound vocabulary for the hearer's suffering.

zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher talks about the importance of utterance instead of uttering.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only in the final 'I announce to you'. Before that, it is a reflection on an event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' is present but functions as a conclusion rather than the substance of the entire address.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, emphasized as the 'utterance of Jesus'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, explicitly in the final paragraph.
tekstueel_bewijs: In the name of the storm-stilling father...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher trusts the 'utterance' to do the work.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The preacher believes in it theoretically, but rhetorically treats it as an explanation for 90% of the time.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong imagery of chaos vs. bread.
tekstueel_bewijs: The bread of life is thrown into the face of the storm of death.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 3rd person 'is/was' to 2nd person 'promises/declares' earlier in the sermon.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus speaks the cadences of the God who presides even in the chaos.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, Jesus speaks these cadences to you: 'I am the one who blots out your transgressions.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical observation to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is 'about' Jesus rather than 'from' Jesus through the preacher.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'I am' quotes from Isaiah not as examples, but as direct address to the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: To your chaos, God says: 'Do not fear, for I am with you.'

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the specific fears listed (pensions, failed self) directly with the word of grace.
voorbeeldzinnen: In your fear of a failed ministry, hear Him: 'It is I.'

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The foundation is solid, just needs earlier activation.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current structure but weave the 'Toezegging' throughout each section.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theological locution that needs more illocutionary courage to be truly sacramental.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT focuses on the 'Creative Word' (Declarative) that changes the hearer's status before God, whereas SvT would focus on the preacher's 'Self-Revelation' or 'Appeal'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The analysis ignores the beauty of the 'chaos' metaphors and focuses strictly on whether the preacher *does* something with the words.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher is 'talking about' the antidote (Jesus' utterance) rather than 'administering' the antidote for most of the sermon.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I announce to you... Jesus will finally utter us beyond our fear.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Binding the speaker to a promise of God's future action.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Very high; this is the 'event' moment.

appendices.notities: The sermon is homiletically 'correct' but SAT reveals a 'Constative Surplus' where the preacher describes the power of the Word instead of letting the Word perform its work earlier.
